qas.question: Which foods do Greek Cypriots and Turkish Cypriots have in common?
Which art forms are integral parts of everyday life?
What is something that Greek Cypriots and Turkish Cypriots do not have in common?
What religion do Greek Cypriots usually practice?

context: Greek Cypriots and Turkish Cypriots share a lot in common in their culture but also have differences. Several traditional food (such as <a0_0>souvla and halloumi<a0_0/>) and beverages are similar, as well as expressions and ways of life. Hospitality and buying or offering food and drinks for guests or others are common among both. In both communities, <a1_0>music, dance and art<a1_0/> are integral parts of social life and many artistic, verbal and nonverbal expressions, traditional dances such as tsifteteli, similarities in dance costumes and importance placed on social activities are shared between the communities. However, the two communities have distinct <a2_0>religions and religious<a2_0/> cultures, with the Greek Cypriots traditionally being Greek Orthodox and Turkish Cypriots traditionally being <a3_0>Sunni Muslims<a3_0/>, which has partly hindered cultural exchange. Greek Cypriots have influences from Greece and Christianity, while Turkish Cypriots have influences from Turkey and Islam.
